headline: Performance Shipping Inc. Secures Two-Year Time Charter Contract for M/T P. Long Beach at US$30,500 Per Day
summary: ATHENS, Greece, Nov. 04, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- November 4, 2025 – Performance Shipping Inc. (NASDAQ: PSHG) (“we” or the “Company”), a global shipping company specializing in the ownership of tanker vessels, today announced that it has entered into a time charter contract with SeaRiver Maritime, a wholly owned subsidiary of ExxonMobil Corporation (“SeaRiver” or the “Charterer”), for its M/T P. Long Beach (the “vessel”), a 105,408 DWT LR2 Aframax tanker, built in 2013. Under the terms of the ag

headline: Sable Offshore (SOC) Is Down 43.4 Percent After Loan Terms Tighten and Governance Scrutiny Intensifies
summary: On November 3, 2025, Sable Offshore Corp. and Exxon Mobil Corporation announced an amendment to their senior secured term loan, raising the interest rate to 15% per annum and extending the maturity date, contingent on Sable raising at least US$225 million in new equity and maintaining monthly cash liquidity of no less than US$25 million. This development coincides with the formation of a Special Committee to investigate allegations of selective disclosure by Sable's CEO and a court ruling...

headline: Exxon Mobil (XOM): Assessing Valuation After Recent Share Price Dip
summary: Exxon Mobil (XOM) has been in focus after recent trading sessions showed a mild slip in its stock price, raising questions about market sentiment. Curious investors may be reevaluating the company’s longer-term appeal as energy dynamics continue to shift. See our latest analysis for Exxon Mobil. Zooming out, Exxon Mobil’s 6% share price return year-to-date shows some underlying momentum, even as the recent mild pullback has investors weighing shifting energy trends and last year’s near-flat...

headline: Looking at the Narrative for Exxon Mobil as Analyst Views and Targets Evolve
summary: Exxon Mobil's consensus analyst price target has recently ticked up from $126.16 to $126.88. This signals increased optimism among experts regarding the company's near-term outlook. This modest boost reflects revised assessments of the company's underlying strengths and ability to navigate current industry conditions. Stay tuned to learn more about how evolving analyst perspectives could help you follow the shifting Exxon Mobil story going forward. Analyst Price Targets don't always capture...

headline: At The Halfway Mark, S&P 500 Earnings Defy Headwinds As Tech And Health Care Deliver Strong Q3
summary: Q3 earnings growth continues to improve. With 64% of constituents reporting thus far, S&P 500 EPS growth for the quarter accelerated to 10.7%. This marks the second peak week of Q3 earnings.
